intro: Lithocarpus menadoensis, commonly known as the Menado stone oak, is a species of evergreen tree native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its hard, dense wood and leathery, evergreen leaves. Its fruit is a one-seed nut enclosed in a woody cupule, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. This plant plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
